link.title: A+ Unlimited Potential | Charter Schools | Houston, Texas

meta.name: description
meta.content: A+ Unlimited Potential is a public charter school located in Houston, Texas. We believe in empowering students to reach and fulfill their unlimited potential through a personalized learning experience that enhances their intellectual development, technological fluency and leadership abilities. The school follows a unique educational approach, giving students opportunities to learn through discovery, hands-on activities and community involvement. Located outside of downtown Houston, in midtown, the school is an open-enrollment public charter school that serves students sixth through eighth grade.

div.class: et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_cta_0 et_animated et_pb_promo et_pb_text_align_justified et_pb_bg_layout_light

div.h2: A+UP HAS MOVED ONLINE DURING STAY-AT-HOME ORDERS

div.p: A+UP was built to be a blended school, where our scholars could learn in the classroom or in the cloud on their computers. Our Phoenix scholars take ownership of their learning--even when they’re in their homes. A+UP Learning Coaches are working with each of our scholars through Zoom or Google Classroom every day. Our scholars are engaged and learning today! We are proud of them and thankful for our families’ support.

Online learning will continue, probably for the rest of the school year (but at least through May 4). We want all families to stay connected, so click below at least three times per week for important updates. Also, follow us on Facebook and check your email for other updates.
If you need to sign up for updates, please click here.

div.p: in an innovative approach that creates an educational experience that values both academic achievement and character development. We leverage the power of technology to personalize an academic plan that is unique to each student.

h2.a: A+UP Open House for Interested Families

div.div: Dear Future Phoenix Families, I just want to send a reminder that we are hosting a session for you all tonight at 6 PM. Please don't miss this unique opportunity to hear about how our school could...

et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_slider et_pb_slider_0 et_hover_enabled et_pb_slider_fullwidth_off
et_pb_slide et_pb_slide_0 et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_slide_with_image et_pb_media_alignment_center et-pb-active-slide

div.p: "I spent a lot of time focusing on everything except for school, but A+UP coaches helped me realize that I needed to change and set goals for my future. With their support, I grew multiple years in math and reading and got much higher scores on STAAR than before. I have a solid foundation for high school now. A+UP helped me grow and grow up!"

"I've heard and thought a lot about the need for educational reform. It's great to be a part of a school that's developing such an innovative approach that will equip these kids to be successful in the 21st-century workforce."

"I like how the coaches are actually helpful. They explain the school assignments when you don't understand, and I have lots of ways to get the help I need. I can get coaching sessions with a coach, work with a tutor or in a small group. I was pretty quiet when I started, but now I am friends with all kinds of kids that are interested in different things."

"I have ADHD, so it can be hard for me to pay attention. A+UP changed all of that. The small classes, small group lessons, one-on-one tutoring and a great relationship with my coaches helped me so much. By the end of the year, I took a Lexia test and was reading on a tenth-grade level. I jumped a thousand points on the STAAR test! If I hadn't started going to A+UP, I would not be on track to go to college."

div.p: A+UP does not exclude from participation in, deny the benefits of, or subject to discrimination on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, disability, or relationship or association with an individual with a disability in providing educational services, activities, and programs, including vocational and career technology programs, in accordance with Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, as amended; the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act, as amended; Title IX of the Educational Amendments of 1972, as amended; the Americans with Disabilities Act, as amended, and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended.
